data.title: A new caterer in town
data.solution:
import math

croissant_recipe = {"Wheat": 21, "Butter": 10.5, "Egg": 0}
chouquettes_recipe = {"Wheat": 60, "Butter": 40, "Egg": 1}
brioche_recipe = {"Wheat": 58.5, "Butter": 29, "Egg": 1}

order = int(input())
total_wheat = 0
total_butter = 0
total_eggs = 0

for i in range(order):
    croissants, chouquettes, brioches = [int(j) for j in input().split()]
    
    total_wheat += croissants * croissant_recipe["Wheat"] + chouquettes * (chouquettes_recipe["Wheat"] / 18) + brioches * brioche_recipe["Wheat"]
    total_butter += croissants * croissant_recipe["Butter"] + chouquettes * (chouquettes_recipe["Butter"] / 18) + brioches * brioche_recipe["Butter"]
    total_eggs += croissants * croissant_recipe["Egg"] + brioches * brioche_recipe["Egg"] + chouquettes / 18

total_wheat = math.ceil(total_wheat)
total_butter = math.ceil(total_butter)
total_eggs = math.ceil(total_eggs)

print(total_wheat, total_butter, total_eggs)
data.statement:
Determine the <<quantities>> you need to produce your orders. Sometimes, there may be several orders for the same location. 
The quantities of the ingredients required are summed up for <<all the orders>>, before rounding up at the end for output.
Recipes : 
- 1 x Croissant : 21g of Wheat, 10.5g of Butter, 0 egg
- 18 x Chouquettes : 60g of Wheat, 40g of Butter, 1 egg 
- 1 x Brioche : 58.5g of Wheat, 29g of Butter, 1 egg

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Determine the quantities you need to produce your orders. Sometimes, there may be several orders for the same location.
The quantities of the ingredients required are summed up for all the orders, before rounding up at the end for output.
Recipes :
- 1 x Croissant : 21g of Wheat, 10.5g of Butter, 0 egg
- 18 x Chouquettes : 60g of Wheat, 40g of Butter, 1 egg
- 1 x Brioche : 58.5g of Wheat, 29g of Butter, 1 egg
Input
Line 1: An integer order for the number of orders.
Next order lines: Each line contains 3 space-separated integers Croissant, Chouquettes and Brioches for the quantities ordered.
Output
Line 1: 3 space-separated integers for the quantities required of wheat, butter and eggs in g (grams).
Constraints
0 <= Croissant <= 1000
0 <= Chouquettes <= 1000
0 <= Brioches <= 1000
Example
Input
1
10 30 3
Output
486 259 5
